definition: honest/sincere/well-behaved/open and guileless/naive

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
honestly speaking/to be frank, ...
(coll.) docile/well-behaved/biddable

sentences.english: To tell you the truth , your father was right when he said that you undersold the company.
sentences.chinese: 老實告訴你，你父親對你低價拋售公司的判斷是對的。

sentences.english: So why is the humble chair being blacklisted?
sentences.chinese: 但爲什麼這次是“老實巴交”的椅子被列入黑名單呢？

sentences.english: I do not like to boast of my own child, but to be sure, Jane -- one does not often see any body better looking.
sentences.chinese: 我並不喜歡誇張自己的孩子，可是說老實話。

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, when I have trouble, I always ask her for advice.
sentences.chinese: 跟你說老實話，每當我有麻煩時總向她徵求意見。

sentences.english: We take him to be an honest man.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲他是個老實人。

sentences.english: They paid their taxes, why can’t they get all their promised benefits?
sentences.chinese: 他們老實納稅，爲什麼不能得到許諾給他們的福利？

sentences.english: He is so honest that he will not accept bribe.
His friends pressed him for the truth about his relationship with Yvonne.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友逼他老實說出跟伊芳的關係。

sentences.english: Now be honest with me, how many of you noticed?
sentences.chinese: 現在老實回答我的問題，你注意到多少呢？

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, dad, I never drink spirit even if I am from the northeast.
sentences.chinese: 爹地，說老實話，雖然是東北人，可我從來不喝白酒。

sentences.english: They made unpleasant insinuations that he might not be quite honest.
sentences.chinese: 他們作出令人不悅的暗示說他可能不很老實。

sentences.english: Honestly speaking, they are worth it. I will take the animals away with me at once.
sentences.chinese: 老實講，它們得要這個價，我這就把牛牽走。

sentences.english: Knavery may serve but honesty is best.
sentences.chinese: 欺詐可能有用，老實卻是上策。

sentences.english: I'm a little nervous about that to be honest with you.
sentences.chinese: 說老實話，我對那有點緊張。

sentences.english: I knew him at once to be an honest man.
sentences.chinese: 我立刻就知道他是個老實人。

sentences.english: His honesty and sincerity prejudiced us in favour of him .
sentences.chinese: 他的忠誠老實使我們對他產生好感。

definition: honest/honesty/honorable/truthful
at the minimum/at the very least
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to do what one is told/obedient
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
so much/this much/how much?/this way/like this
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
should not/to owe nothing
single-minded/concentrated
intelligent/clever/bright/smart/acute (of sight and hearing)
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
wretched (esp. appearance)/vulgar
to take care of one's family
